meta.hint:
A prefix can be added to the beginning of a base word. Some common prefixes are mis-, pre- and re-.
A suffix can be added to the end of a base word. Some common suffixes are -able, -ful, -less, -ly, -ment and -ness.
Both prefixes and suffixes change the meaning of the base word.
meta.question: Select the correct meaning of the  word with Prefix  and suffix.

content.description:
What does the word mean?
Greatly
content.extra: in a great way,  without greatness

content.description:
What does the word mean?
Miscount
content.extra: count incorrectly, able to be counted

content.description:
What does the word mean?
Sureness
content.extra: the state of being sure, without being sure

content.description:
What does the word mean?
Misdirect

What does the word mean?
Reuse
content.extra: use again, able to be used
